alert.note: Alert for Denton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 01 at 2:51PM CDT until September 03 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Denton and Tarrant. * WHEN...Until 415 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Water will quickly accumulate within construction zones, particularly along Interstate 35W and Highway 170. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas have already experienced minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
